pros: Great benefits , vacation time and the way we all work together.

review_title: Great team but needs improvement on management

cons: The nurses forget to put up signs for people’s safety. The management needs a lot of Improvement they will call you in on your days off full time are not. A couple people on the team act like high school mean girls are pass work on other people so they can sit all day and don’t bother complaining to management they don’t care.

review_title: Family vibes- Nursing managers are the evil stepmoms

cons: Nurses under appreciated, under paid, and managers do not have your back

review_title: Not fair and managers didn’t know laws

pros: Some of the coworkers are awesome to work with. Benefits are ok.
cons: Other coworkers are just “warm bodies”. Not everyone has to be a team player and if you are a team player be prepared to be taken advantage of. If you complain then you are deemed difficult and told to deal with it.

cons: Co workers not as friendly as I had hoped they would be, but not a deal breaker.

cons: As PRN they can also work you into the ground. They have a hard time retaining employees.

pros: I really did like it...facility clean, generally no problem getting repairs, hours were exactly matching what I needed.
cons: New director with a mandate to cut expenses. Was second oldest in department, oldest was a manager. Hours were changed, then cut. Fired over something that he knew was being done in a side discipline, and warned those employees not to speak to me.

review_title: Descent coworkers but pay is extremely low.
pros: Most coworkers are genuinely helpful and wonderful to work with. The cafeteria good is amazing and great prices especially with employee discount.
cons: Supervisors don't do much, they tend to pass of most of their work to their employees. The are suppose to be one set schedule luke everyone else and most tend to come in whenever they want. They "forget" to clock in and have others fix their time. If the department is short staffed others are expected to work 10+ hours a day with no break, not even lunch.
